name: Debt Dependency
title: Reliance on Multilateral Debt
description: In 2023, Afghanistan's multilateral debt service accounted for 100% of its public and publicly guaranteed debt service, indicating a heavy reliance on external financial support.

name: Health Cost Burden
title: Health Expenditure and Poverty
description: In 2020, 6.05% of the population was pushed below the $2.15 poverty line due to out-of-pocket health expenses, with 6.5% falling below the 60% median consumption poverty line.

name: Pollution Peril
title: High Female Mortality from Pollution
description: In 2019, the mortality rate for females attributed to household and ambient air pollution was 265 per 100,000, highlighting significant environmental health challenges.

name: Youth in Limbo
title: High Female Youth Unemployment and Inactivity
description: By 2024, 82.6% of female youth were not in education, employment, or training, reflecting a critical gap in youth engagement and opportunities.

name: Domestic Violence Norms
title: Prevalence of Justified Domestic Violence Beliefs
description: In 2015, 80.2% of women believed a husband is justified in beating his wife for any of five reasons, with 66.9% agreeing if she goes out without telling him.

name: Family Work Reliance
title: High Female Contribution to Family Work
description: In 2023, 66.8% of female employment was in contributing family work, indicating a reliance on unpaid or low-paid family labor.

name: Service Spending
title: Significant Government Spending on Services
description: In 2017, 54.8% of government expenses were allocated to goods and services, reflecting a focus on service provision.

name: Regional Trade Ties
title: Middle East & North Africa Import Dependency
description: In 2023, 23.7% of Afghanistan's merchandise imports came from low- and middle-income economies in the Middle East & North Africa, indicating regional trade ties.

name: Water Woes
title: Lowest Water Productivity
description: In 2021, Afghanistan had the lowest water productivity globally, generating only $0.81 GDP per cubic meter of freshwater withdrawal.

name: Credit Crunch
title: Minimal Domestic Credit to Private Sector
description: In 2020, Afghanistan's domestic credit to the private sector was just 3.1% of GDP, one of the lowest globally, indicating limited financial support for businesses.

name: Inflation Anomaly
title: Negative Inflation Rate
description: Afghanistan experienced a rare negative inflation rate of -6.6% in 2024, reflecting deflationary pressures in the economy.

name: Budget Blues
title: Low Government Expenditure Efficiency
description: In 2021, Afghanistan's primary government expenditures were only 48.7% of the original approved budget, indicating inefficiencies in fiscal management.

name: Economic Struggles
title: Lowest Economic Management Rating
description: Afghanistan's CPIA economic management cluster average was the lowest globally at 1.17 in 2023, highlighting challenges in economic governance.

name: Gender Gap
title: Lowest Gender Equality Rating
description: In 2023, Afghanistan had the lowest CPIA gender equality rating of 1, underscoring significant gender disparities.

name: Infrastructure Issues
title: Poor Logistics Performance
description: Afghanistan's logistics performance index for infrastructure quality was just 1.7 in 2022, indicating significant challenges in trade and transport infrastructure.

name: Education Inequality
title: Low Gender Parity in Education
description: In 2022, the gender parity index for youth literacy in Afghanistan was only 0.54, reflecting significant educational disparities between genders.

name: Health Funding Gaps
title: Minimal Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, Afghanistan's domestic government health expenditure per capita was only $0.63, one of the lowest globally, indicating limited public health funding.

name: Workforce Imbalance
title: Low Female Labor Force Participation
description: In 2024, only 6.8% of Afghanistan's labor force was female, highlighting significant gender imbalances in employment.
